data.author: Peter Summers

changelog.release_notes: Fix for phones that return a heading when the speed is zero.
Fixes an minor cosmetic issue with the direction pointer.
Cleaned up the compass face display code.
Support for the larger screen on the Pebble Time 2.

Car mode is now remembered between sessions.

Workaround for compass bug removed, as the new firmware that fixes it has been our for several weeks now.  If you suffer crashes, make sure your firmware is 4.1.x.
Fixes the compass issue when toggling car mode.

Fixes a problem with not being able to request information or send pins twice.  

Removes the default to car mode setting, which was where I'd introduced the problem and which isn't as necessary now as I have a better workaround for the compass bug.
Tweaked the compass bug workaround to improve battery life.

Puts the destination description on the menu as an app glance.

Works around the compass bug in SDK4.0.

Doesn't turn the compass on until it's asked for, so that Car Mode can be turned on to avoid a compass bug with Pebble OS 4.0.

Also supports Pebble 2 (which has no compass).

If the compass bug is a big problem to you, look at https://github.com/Freeyourgadget/Gadgetbridge/wiki/Pebble-Firmware-updates for details of how to downgrade.
Adds a setting that allows Car Mode to default to on or off.

Handles watch with no compass (Pebble 2) and gives appropriate error message.
Displays direction to target when there is no compass reading or no compass.
Returns orientation to north after leaving car mode.

Improved handling of GPS errors.  
Tidied up the compass calibration code.
Filters the compass updates to reduce noise (works around a bug with  compass_service_set_heading_filter).
Improved handling of the compass - gives a helpful error message when the direction is unavailable.
Only shows a direction arrow if the compass is returning a direction or in car mode and a direction of motion is available.

Avoids rounding the distance to an integer twice.
Shows any valid speed, no matter how low.
Fixes a problem with the message not appearing to say that the new location had been set.
Avoids restarting the acquisition process when it's not required.

Finally, provides an easy mechanism for setting favorite locations - simply put a label in the settings field (any text ending in a ":") and the program will append the last acquired location to it.

Come on guys, this has to be worth a heart!  :-)

Reads the location when shaken along the Y axis if the interval is one minute or more.

Accepts lower case n, s, w, e for latitude and longitude.
Displays an error when the location isn't available.
